page.title: 08DRUMOAK DORIC WORD DATABASE
page.content: In 1985 Drumoak School pupils as part of their education worked on Scottish poetry.They made lists of words which they didn't know,found their meanings, then printed the Scots words into a Computer Database. The pupils then made lists of dialect words used by the pupils and parents in everyday communication.The pupils then made another Database Dictionary of local words still used in 1985. Soon afterwards Mr Billy Kay,presenter of the BBC Television series Odyssey, visited the school. Mr Kay, Mr Hendry the Headmaster and pupils who had worked on the Databases talked about many of the words in the Databases in an interview for a BBC Radio Programme about the use of dialect words in everyday language in modern Scotland.
